Interface ColumnTypeResolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
DerbyColumnTypeResolver, H2ColumnTypeResolver, SQLiteColumnTypeResolver
public interface ColumnTypeResolver
Interface for resolving SQL column types based on Java field types.

This interface defines methods for mapping Java data types to their corresponding SQL column types based on the target database. Implementations are expected to provide type mappings for different databases.

It provides two resolution methods:

  • resolve(Field) - Resolves the SQL type for a given field.
  • resolve(Field, String, Map) - Resolves the SQL type with additional database-specific type mapping.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type

    String
    resolve(Field field)
    Resolves the SQL column type for the given Java field.

  • Method Details

    • resolve

      String resolve(Field field) throws UnsupportedFieldTypeException
      Resolves the SQL column type for the given Java field.
      Parameters:
      field - The Java field for which the SQL type is to be determined.
      Returns:
      A string representing the SQL column type.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedFieldTypeException - If the field type is not supported.

    • resolve

      default String resolve(Field field, String databaseEngine, Map<Class<?>,String> typeMap) throws UnsupportedFieldTypeException
      Resolves the SQL column type based on the provided field, database engine, and type mapping.

      This method checks the provided type map for a corresponding SQL type. If no mapping is found, an UnsupportedFieldTypeException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      field - The Java field to be resolved.
      databaseEngine - The target database engine (e.g., "H2", "SQLite").
      typeMap - A map of Java classes to SQL column type representations.
      Returns:
      The SQL column type as a string.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedFieldTypeException - If the field type is not supported in the given database.
